t: Pulsing fingertips - Is it normal to feel pulse on fingertips, | Practo Consult
How to take your pulse: MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia Image
s: How to take your pulse. 1. Place the tips of your index and middle finger on the inside of your wrist below the base of your thumb. 2. Press lightly. You will feel the blood pulsing beneath your fingers.

t: Finger Pain: 15 Causes, Types, Diagnosis & Treatment
s: July 15, 2024 - Finger pain is a throbbing, cramplike, or achy pain that’s felt in any of your fingers or your thumb. It’s often caused by an accident or a medical condition like carpal tunnel. In most cases, it’ll go away on its own, but unexplained finger pain can be a sign of something more serious.

t: Your finger's pulse holds the key to your heart's health | Iowa Now - The University of Iowa
s: May 9, 2023 - A University of Iowa physiologist has a new technique to measure the stiffness of the aorta, a common risk factor for heart disease. The procedure involves measuring the pulse in the finger or on the arm, combined with an individual's age and body mass index.
